message.content:
To align a row of divs to the right using flex in CSS, you can set the `justify-content` property of the container element to `flex-end`. Here's an example: HTML: ```html
Item 1
Item 2
Item 3
``` CSS: ```css .container { display: flex; } .item { flex: 1; } ``` In the CSS code above, we set the `display` property of the `.container` element to `flex`, which enables flexbox for its child elements. Then, we apply `justify-content: flex-end;` to align the items to the right. Here's how it looks: [Insert an image or screenshot showing the divs aligned to the right] In this example, all the divs with the class "item" are placed in a row and aligned to the right of the container. The `flex: 1;` rule ensures that each item takes up an equal amount of space within the container. You can adjust the number of items or add more styling as needed for your specific use case.
